OVERVIEW



 
Fossil Power Plant Fundamentals
August 21 - 22 2007

This is an introductory course designed to improve general knowledge
              of Fossil Power Plant operations, and their major components. This
              course will provide you with an understanding of Fossil Power Generation,
              and will concentrate on fundamental principles and concepts. Attendees
              will be provided with various examples and illustrations to reinforce
            the information given.
 Each attendee will receive a detailed workbook with explicit
                        information on Fossil Power Plants, their design, concept, and
                        functions including components and their operations.
Course Objectives 
This 1 1⁄2 - day course will provide a basic knowledge of Fossil
                        Power Plants, their major components, and Fossil Power Production.
                        Attendees will be provided with the following information:

 Basic principles of Fossil Power Plant production Major components:
                          their function and description within the Fossil Power Plant
 Energy Conversion from fuel input conversion thru generator
                          electrical output
 Condenser and Auxiliaries, how they are used and why they
                          are necessary
 Function of regenerative equipment in the condensate/feedwater
                          system and its function in conjunction with the boiler and condenser
 Functions and descriptions of the various pumps

Who Should Attend 

New Fossil Power Plant employees with limited power industry
                          experience
 Regulators, Commission Staff (State and Federal), Attorneys,
                          ISO’s/RTO’s, Industry Vendors, and anyone else who
                          desires a basic knowledge of Fossil Power Plants
 Technicians, Operators, and Maintenance personnel who desire
                          a better understanding of Fossil Power Plants and their component’s
                          functions
 Fossil Power Plant Administrative and/or support personnel
 Recent College Graduates


Gas Turbine Fundamentals
August 22 - 23, 2007 

This purpose of this course is to familiarize gas turbine operators
              and maintenance personnel with the fundamentals of gas turbine
              operation, including the principles of heat transfer and thermodynamics.
              It will also cover the gas turbine familiarization, Control System
              Overview, Maintenance Overview, and Unit Operation. The purpose
              of this training is to provide maintenance, operations, engineering,
              and management staff a broad based familiarization of the technology’s
            features, system operations, and maintenance concepts.
 
Who Should Attend 
 
Personnel requiring general familiarization specifically in the
                          areas of routine maintenance, on-site repair, operations, troubleshooting,
                          and performance for gas turbines.
